intro: Toxocarpus racemosus, commonly known as the racemose toxocarpus, is a flowering plant species native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenia plants. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Toxocarpus racemosus is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and along stream banks.
